III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was started on Seroquel on 1/25/24 and the youth's
mother gave verbal consent on 2/3/24 for the medication.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
02/07/2024.
I spoke with the Complainant on 02/07/2024, no additional
information was provided.
Interviews:
I interviewed Youth A’s JJ Worker on 02/07/2024. She was
notified Youth A was hospitalized from 01/20/2024 thru
01/23/2024 and the hospital changed his medication. She said
Youth A’s mother was contacted by the hospital and provided
verbal consent for treatment.
I interviewed Youth A’s Mother via telephone on 02/07/2024. She
reported receiving a call from Henry Ford Hospital on 01/20/2024
requesting verbal consent to treat Youth A. She received a call on
02/03/2024 from the doctor at the facility requesting verbal
consent to get a refill for the medication, Seroquel. Youth A’s
Mother provided verbal consent to the hospital and the facility
regarding treatment and medication changes. She expressed no
concerns regarding the facility in reference to notifying and
requesting consent.
I interviewed Chief Administrator (CA) at the facility on
02/08/2024. CA reported Youth A was hospitalized on 01/20/2024
through 01/23/2024 due to thoughts of self-harming. He said the
hospital did receive verbal consent from Youth A’s Mother to treat
Youth A, the hospital discharged Youth A with a 10-day
prescription for Seroquel. The facility’s doctor contacted Youth A’s
Mother on 02/05/2024 and received verbal consent to refill the
medication.
2

I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 02/08/2024. Youth A has
been at the facility for two months. He reported taking his
medication daily. He said the nurse gives him his medication.
Youth A said he was hospitalized last month for feeling
depressed. He said the doctor did make changes to his
medication, but he does not know what medication he is taking.
Youth A reported he has weekly individual and group therapy.
Youth A did not express any concerns regarding the facility.
I interviewed Nurse 1 at the facility on 02/08/2024. Nurse 1
confirmed Youth A was hospitalized from 01/20/2024 to
01/23/2024 for depression. She said she received verbal consent
from Youth A’s Mother for hospital admission and treatment. The
hospital changed Youth A’s medication from Abilify to Seroquel
and discharged Youth A with a 10-day prescription for Seroquel.
The medication was filled on 01/24/2024 and Youth A began
taking the medication on 01/25/2024. Nurse 1 said the agency
always requests parental/guardian consent for any medical
treatment or medication changes. In this situation the hospital did
obtain verbal consent from Youth A’s Mother for treatment, and
the hospital discharged Youth A with a 10-day prescription for the
medication. She said the agency’s doctor called Youth A’s Mother
on 02/03/2024 and obtained verbal consent to refill the
medication.
I interviewed Doctor via telephone on 02/09/2024. Doctor
reported the hospital changed Youth A’s medication on
01/20/2024 and provided a 10-day supply of the medication
(Seroquel). The Doctor confirmed she contacted Youth A’s Mother
on 02/03/2024 and received verbal consent to obtain a refill on
Seroquel.
Documents Reviewed:
• Psychiatric medication review for Youth A dated
01/19/2024. Youth A is irritable, having trouble sleeping,
tried to form a weapon, punched a wall, expressed feeling
depressed and not wanting to be in the program. Doctor
contact Youth A’s mother on 01/19/2024 for verbal consent
to increase Abilify from 7.5 mg to 10mg.
• Medical record for Youth A from Henry Ford Hospital dated
01/20/2024. Youth A was hospitalized from 01/20/2024
through 01/23/2024 for depression and conduct disorder.
Summary: Medication changed, stop taking Abilify and start
taking Seroquel.
3

Medication log for Youth A. Youth A started taking Seroquel
on 01/25/2024.
• Agency Medical Consent Policy: Every youth has the right
to be informed concerning the evaluations, assessments,
treatments, and procedures he/she may receive during
his/her care and treatment. Every youth, along with the
legal guardian/parent(s), will have the opportunity to
consent to treatment upon admission. Informed consent is
defined by the agreement of a youth or his/her legal
guardian/parent(s) to treatment, evaluation, or procedure
after the youth or his/her legal guardian/parent(s) receive
the material facts about the nature, consequences, risks of
the proposed treatment, evaluation, or procedure; the
alternatives to it; and the prognosis if the proposed
intervention is not undertaken.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule based on interviews and
documentation. Youth A was hospitalized on 01/20/2024 and the
hospital contacted Youth A’s Mother and obtained verbal consent
to treat Youth A. Youth A was discharged from the hospital with a
10-day prescription for the medication. On 02/03/2024 the facility
contacted Youth A’s Mother and obtained verbal consent to refill
Youth A’s medication.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
